concept.title: Group Management
concept.shortdesc: Information about managing groups in the Marketing Cloud.

conbody.p: A Group is a container for users. You add users to the group, then enable access to a solution at the group level. For example, you can create a group that has Analytics rights, and add users to the group. Contact Customer Care if you are an administrator but do not see the Tools link.
The following table describes the interface elements available on the Group Management page and when adding or editing a group.

entry.p: (Required) The name of the group account. This name is displayed on the Group Management page.
A user-defined description of your group. This description displays in Group Management.
Names, username (email), and the titles for group members.
Lets you specify the email of an existing Marketing Cloud user to add to this group.
Lets you assign the group access to the Marketing Cloud and solutions.
entry.note: To enable single sign-on between the Marketing Cloud and a solution, users must join the marketing cloud by linking the accounts.

entry.p: The number of users in the group.
When you add users, they are invited by email. The email recipient must click Accept in the email, which confirms the address. At that point, the account is registered.
